snippet: An assistant conductor on the Amtrak train said she heard the engineer tell another operator in a radio transmission that the train had just been struck by something.
abstract: National Transportation Safety Board officials say assistant conductor of Amtrak train that derailed in Philadelphia has told them that train may have been struck by projectile; conductor says that engineer on regional train line had said on radio that his train had been struck and Amtrak engineer Brandon Bostian had replied that his train had been struck as well; Bostian no longer recalls this fact.

byline.original: By DAVE PHILIPPS and EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS

lead_paragraph: An assistant conductor on the Amtrak train said she heard the engineer tell another operator in a radio transmission that the train had just been struck by something.

headline.main: Amtrak Train Possibly Hit Before Wreck
headline.print_headline: Amtrak Train Possibly Hit Before Wreck
